tasks.context: Write unit tests for sdk/typescript/src/auth.ts (26 lines). Source exports: (1) createAuthHeaders(apiKey:string) returns {Authorization:'Bearer '+apiKey, 'X-Request-Id':randomUUID(), 'X-Timestamp':new Date().toISOString()}, (2) validateApiKey(key:string) returns boolean via regex /^inv_[0-9a-f]{32}$/, (3) signRequest(apiKey,method,path,body?) returns createHmac('sha256',apiKey).update(method+':'+path+':'+(body||'')).digest('hex'), (4) ApiKeyError extends Error with name='ApiKeyError'. Tests: verify createAuthHeaders returns correct Authorization header, has X-Request-Id (UUID format), has X-Timestamp (ISO date). Test validateApiKey with valid key 'inv_'+32 hex chars returns true, invalid keys (wrong prefix, too short, too long, non-hex chars) return false. Test signRequest produces consistent HMAC output for same inputs, different output for different inputs, handles missing body as empty string. Test ApiKeyError has correct name and message. Mock crypto.randomUUID via jest.mock('crypto') to return a fixed UUID for deterministic testing. Use jest.spyOn(global,'Date') or jest.useFakeTimers for timestamp.

issues.description: Could add more specific assertions for HMAC output format (hex string, 64 chars) rather than just checking length
Missing test for ApiKeyError inheritance from Error class

strengths: Proper mocking of crypto.randomUUID with deterministic output
Correct use of jest.useFakeTimers for timestamp testing
Comprehensive validateApiKey tests covering all edge cases (wrong prefix, length, non-hex chars)
Good test organization with describe blocks for each function
Tests signRequest consistency and variation correctly
Handles optional body parameter testing properly
Clean setup/teardown with beforeEach/afterEach
Mocks crypto.randomUUID for deterministic UUID testing
Uses jest.useFakeTimers to fix the timestamp
Covers valid and invalid API key patterns
Verifies HMAC behavior for consistency, variability, and missing body
Checks ApiKeyError name and message

tasks.context: Write unit tests for sdk/typescript/src/client-config.ts (89 lines). Source exports: constants DEFAULT_BASE_URL='https://api.invoica.ai/v1', DEFAULT_TIMEOUT=30000, DEFAULT_MAX_RETRIES=3. Function resolveConfig(config:InvoicaClientConfig):ResolvedConfig — if !config.apiKey or empty string, throws Error('InvoicaClientConfig: apiKey is required and cannot be empty'). Otherwise returns {apiKey:config.apiKey.trim(), baseUrl:config.baseUrl||DEFAULT_BASE_URL, timeout:config.timeout||DEFAULT_TIMEOUT, maxRetries:config.maxRetries||DEFAULT_MAX_RETRIES}. Tests: verify DEFAULT_BASE_URL, DEFAULT_TIMEOUT, DEFAULT_MAX_RETRIES export values. Test resolveConfig with only apiKey returns all defaults. Test resolveConfig with all options returns provided values. Test resolveConfig trims apiKey whitespace. Test resolveConfig throws for empty string apiKey. Test resolveConfig throws for undefined apiKey. Test resolveConfig with partial overrides (only timeout set, rest default). No mocks needed — pure functions.

issues.description: Error message assertion could be more specific - currently only checks for 'apiKey is required' but spec shows full message 'InvoicaClientConfig: apiKey is required and cannot be empty'
Missing assertion for apiKey in the 'all options set' test - only checks baseUrl, timeout, maxRetries but not the apiKey value

The test case for "returns provided values when all options set" does not explicitly assert the returned apiKey; consider adding an assertion for result.apiKey to complete full coverage of that scenario.

strengths: All required test cases from specification are implemented
Proper TypeScript usage with correct imports
Good test structure with descriptive test names
Covers edge cases like whitespace trimming and undefined values
Uses proper Jest assertions and expect syntax
Tests both happy path and error conditions
No unnecessary mocks as specified - pure function testing
Validates all exported constants with exact values
Tests partial configuration overrides correctly
No markdown code fences in source files
Tests cover defaults, trimming, error cases, and partial overrides
Follows Jest best practices and readable structure

tasks.context: Write unit tests for sdk/typescript/src/environment.ts (43 lines). Source exports: type SdkEnvironment='node'|'browser'|'edge'|'unknown'. Functions: (1) detectEnvironment() checks globalThis.process.versions.node → 'node', globalThis.EdgeRuntime string → 'edge', globalThis.window+document → 'browser', else 'unknown'. (2) getDefaultBaseUrl() returns 'https://api.invoica.ai/v1'. (3) getUserAgent() returns `invoica-sdk/1.0.0 (${detectEnvironment()})`. (4) supportsStreaming() returns typeof ReadableStream !== 'undefined'. Tests: Test detectEnvironment returns 'node' in default Jest/Node env. Test getDefaultBaseUrl returns correct URL. Test getUserAgent contains 'invoica-sdk/1.0.0' and includes environment. Test supportsStreaming returns boolean. For edge/browser detection, temporarily modify globalThis in tests: set globalThis.EdgeRuntime='edge' then call detectEnvironment, clean up in afterEach. For browser: set globalThis.window={} and globalThis.document={}, verify returns 'browser'. For unknown: delete process from globalThis temporarily. Always restore originals in afterEach to avoid test pollution.

issues.description: Could add explicit test for ReadableStream presence/absence in supportsStreaming() to verify the actual implementation logic
Missing import validation - should verify SdkEnvironment type is properly imported even though not directly tested

strengths: Excellent globalThis manipulation with proper cleanup in afterEach to prevent test pollution
Comprehensive coverage of all environment detection scenarios (node, edge, browser, unknown)
Proper handling of undefined vs defined globals during restoration
Tests follow the exact specification requirements including temporary modifications
Good test isolation - each test properly sets up its own environment state
Validates both positive and negative cases for environment detection
Proper TypeScript usage with appropriate type assertions for globalThis manipulation
Tests cover all specified functions: detectEnvironment, getDefaultBaseUrl, getUserAgent, supportsStreaming.
Includes edge, browser, and unknown environment scenarios by manipulating globalThis.
afterEach hook cleanly restores global state to prevent cross-test interference.
Assertions verify both content and type where appropriate.

tasks.context: Write unit tests for sdk/typescript/src/events.ts (29 lines). Source exports: type SdkEventMap with 4 event types: 'request:start'{method,url}, 'request:end'{method,url,status,durationMs}, 'request:error'{method,url,error}, 'rate-limit:hit'{retryAfter}. Class SdkEventEmitter with methods: on(event,listener) adds listener to Map<event,Set<Function>>, off(event,listener) removes from set, emit(event,data) calls all listeners for event, removeAllListeners() clears the map. Tests: create new SdkEventEmitter(). Test on+emit: register listener for 'request:start', emit event, verify listener called with correct data. Test off: register listener, remove it, emit, verify NOT called. Test multiple listeners: register 2 listeners for same event, emit, both called. Test removeAllListeners: register listeners for multiple events, call removeAllListeners, emit all events, verify none called. Test emit with no listeners does not throw. Test different event types work independently. No mocks needed — pure class.

issues.description: Test on line 25 emits 'request:start' but includes status and durationMs which belong to 'request:end' event type
There is no direct assertion verifying that the 'request:end' event listener receives the correct payload shape (status and durationMs).

strengths: Complete test coverage of all required functionality (on, off, emit, removeAllListeners)
Tests all 4 event types from SdkEventMap (request:start, request:end, request:error, rate-limit:hit)
Proper Jest mock usage with jest.fn()
Good test isolation - each test creates new SdkEventEmitter instance
Tests edge cases like emit with no listeners and event type independence
Clear, descriptive test names that explain expected behavior
Proper TypeScript usage with correct event payload structures
No code fences or syntax issues
Comprehensive coverage of event emitter behaviors (on, off, multiple listeners, removeAllListeners).
Tests for no-listener emit and independent event types to prevent cross-event pollution.
Covers payloads for 'request:start', 'request:error', and 'rate-limit:hit'.
Clean and readable Jest syntax with jest.fn() spies.

tasks.context: Write unit tests for sdk/typescript/src/request-builder.ts (37 lines). Source exports: interface RequestConfig{method,path,query?,body?,headers?}. Function buildUrl(baseUrl:string,path:string,query?:Record<string,string|number|boolean|undefined>):string — creates new URL(baseUrl+path), iterates query entries, sets searchParams for non-undefined values, returns url.toString(). Function buildHeaders(apiKey:string,extra?:Record<string,string>):Record<string,string> — returns {Authorization:'Bearer '+apiKey, 'Content-Type':'application/json', 'User-Agent':'countable-sdk/1.0.0', ...extra}. Tests: buildUrl with base+path only returns correct URL. buildUrl with query params appends them as search params. buildUrl skips undefined query values. buildUrl with number and boolean query values converts to strings. buildHeaders returns Authorization with Bearer prefix. buildHeaders includes Content-Type application/json. buildHeaders includes User-Agent. buildHeaders merges extra headers. buildHeaders extra headers can override defaults. No mocks needed — pure functions.

issues.description: Query param order tests use .toContain() which doesn't verify complete URL structure - could use more precise assertions
Missing edge case tests for empty query objects, special characters in URLs, or malformed base URLs

strengths: Clean test structure with proper describe blocks and descriptive test names

Comprehensive coverage of buildUrl scenarios: base-only, query params, skipping undefined, converting number/boolean.

Correct file placement and naming under __tests__ directory.

tasks.context: Write unit tests for sdk/typescript/src/webhook.ts (13 lines). Source imports createHmac,timingSafeEqual from 'crypto'. Exports: (1) verifyWebhookSignature(payload:string,signature:string,secret:string):boolean — computes expected=createHmac('sha256',secret).update(payload,'utf8').digest('hex'), converts signature and expected to Buffers, returns sigBuf.length===expBuf.length && timingSafeEqual(sigBuf,expBuf). (2) parseWebhookEvent(payload:string):{id,type,data,createdAt} — JSON.parse(payload), returns {id:parsed.id, type:parsed.type, data:parsed.data, createdAt:parsed.createdAt}. Tests: test verifyWebhookSignature with correct signature returns true (compute real HMAC with crypto in test). Test with wrong signature returns false. Test with wrong secret returns false. Test parseWebhookEvent returns correct fields from valid JSON. Test parseWebhookEvent with extra fields only returns id,type,data,createdAt. Test parseWebhookEvent throws on invalid JSON. No mocks needed — use real crypto for verification.

issues.description: Could benefit from edge case testing (empty payload, null values, malformed timestamps)
Missing test for signature format edge cases (non-hex strings, different lengths)

strengths: Follows task specification exactly - all required test cases implemented

tasks.context: Write unit tests for frontend/components/ui/confirm-dialog.tsx (108 lines) using React Testing Library + Jest. Source exports: ConfirmDialog({open,onClose,onConfirm,title,message,confirmLabel='Confirm',cancelLabel='Cancel',variant='danger'}). When open=false returns null. When open=true renders dialog with role='dialog', aria-modal='true', shows title (h3 with id='confirm-dialog-title'), message (p with id='confirm-dialog-message'). Cancel button calls onClose. Confirm button calls onConfirm() then onClose(). Escape key calls onClose (via document keydown listener). Clicking overlay (outer div) calls onClose. Clicking inner dialog content does NOT close (stopPropagation). Sets document.body.style.overflow='hidden' on open, 'unset' on cleanup. Tests: render with open=false, verify nothing rendered (queryByRole('dialog') is null). Render with open=true, verify title and message displayed. Click cancel button, verify onClose called. Click confirm button, verify onConfirm and onClose both called. Test custom confirmLabel and cancelLabel rendered. Test escape key fires onClose via fireEvent.keyDown(document,'Escape'). Test overlay click fires onClose. Import from '../confirm-dialog'. Use @testing-library/react render, screen, fireEvent.

issues.description: Test for overlay click detection relies on container.firstChild which may be brittle - should use a more specific selector or data-testid
Could add test for variant prop if it affects rendering behavior
The tests verify the presence of title and message but do not assert the specific id attributes ('confirm-dialog-title' and 'confirm-dialog-message') as required by the spec.

strengths: Covers all specified test cases from the task requirements
Proper use of React Testing Library patterns (screen queries, fireEvent)
Good test isolation with beforeEach cleanup of mocks and body styles
Tests both positive and negative cases (open=false returns null)
Verifies accessibility attributes (role='dialog', aria-modal='true')
Tests event propagation correctly (overlay vs inner content clicks)
Validates body overflow style management on mount/unmount
Uses semantic queries (getByRole, getByText) for better test reliability
Proper Jest mock usage and cleanup
Covers open=false and open=true rendering paths
Tests both default and custom confirm/cancel label rendering
Validates callback invocation order for confirm and close
Includes escape key and overlay click behavior
Ensures document.body.style.overflow is set and cleaned up
